DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate a possible correlation between predictive precesarean section pain and development of postcaesarean section pain using the PM. Patients and Methods 46 healthy pregnant women scheduled for elective cesarean section is included after informed consent. The standard operation procedures included spinal anesthesia, paracetamol 1 g 8 hourly, diclofenac 50 mg 8 hourly and oxycontine 10 mg x 2. Morphine was used for break-through pain. Before cesarian section the threshold for sensory and pain were measured 3 times, and the average was used for analyses. After cesarian section a blinded midwife assess the pain at rest and during mobilization every 12th hours over 2 days score. Data was analyzed using AUC and non-parametric test, P < 0,05.
DOC.brief_title: Prediction of Postoperative Pain by an Electrical Pain Stimulus
DOC.criteria: Healthy pregnant women scheduled for elective cesarean section ASA III IV Chronic pain conditions. Pacemaker.
